cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, then arc northwest into the eastern Gulf, make landfall along the north-central Florida Gulf Coast, then accelerate northeastward across Georgia/South Carolina and move offshore of the Carolinas into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend region)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts inside the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (â‰¤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late in the 5-day period; operationally winds should remain below gale force at Wilmington, DE.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington, DE under the current track scenario.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional showers possible next weekend when the remnant circulation passes well offshore; heavy rain totals not anticipated.
